text: they were kidnapped as schoolgirls but
will now be young women three years ago
today the students preparing for final
exams were abducted from this school the
Islamist extremist of Boko Haram opposed
Western education they lauded the girls
on two trunks and then drove them into
the darkness the mass kidnapping shone a
spotlight on the brutal Boko Haram
insurgency which has killed thousands
and forced millions to flee the homes in
Northeast Nigeria the abduction sparked
international condemnation and led to
the campaign bring back our girls an end
late last year joyous seems more than 20
of the schoolgirls were freed following
negotiations known nigeria's president
says talks are ongoing with Boko Haram
and that they'll bend over backwards to
secure the release of all the remaining
students a security improves slowly
children are once again getting an
education but abductions are still
taking place for every chubak schoolgirl
many other children have been kidnapped
by the militants Martin tations BBC News
Nigeria
